Retrospective reviews of prediagnostic CT scans, when conducted by expert radiologists aware that the patient later developed PDAC, frequently reveal lesions that were previously overlooked. To help detecting these lesions earlier, we developed an automated system named ePAI (early Pancreatic cancer detection with Artificial Intelligence). It was trained on data from 1,598 patients from a single medical center. In the internal test involving 1,009 patients, ePAI achieved an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) of 0.939-0.999, a sensitivity of 95.3%, and a specificity of 98.7% for detecting small PDAC less than 2 cm in diameter, precisely localizing PDAC as small as 2 mm. In an external test involving 7,158 patients across 6 centers, ePAI achieved an AUC of 0.918-0.945, a sensitivity of 91.5%, and a specificity of 88.0%, precisely localizing PDAC as small as 5 mm. Importantly, ePAI detected PDACs on prediagnostic CT scans obtained 3 to 36 months before clinical diagnosis that had originally been overlooked by radiologists. It successfully detected and localized PDACs in 75 of 159 patients, with a median lead time of 347 days before clinical diagnosis. Our multi-reader study showed that ePAI significantly outperformed 30 board-certified radiologists by 50.3% (P < 0.05) in sensitivity while maintaining a comparable specificity of 95.4% in detecting PDACs early and prediagnostic. These findings suggest its potential of ePAI as an assistive tool to improve early detection of pancreatic cancer.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为ePAI的AI系统，用于在CT扫描中早期检测胰腺导管腺癌（PDAC），在内部和外部测试中均表现出高AUC、敏感性和特异性，并能在临床诊断前数月发现被放射科医生遗漏的病灶。
AI.motivation: PDAC常在晚期才被发现，而回顾性分析显示专家放射科医生可在患者确诊前的CT中识别出先前被忽略的病灶，因此亟需自动化工具辅助早期检测。
AI.method: 开发了基于单中心1598例患者数据训练的深度学习系统ePAI，用于自动检测和精确定位PDAC病灶，并在内部（1009例）和外部多中心（7158例）数据集上进行验证；还开展了多读片者研究以对比ePAI与30名认证放射科医生的表现。
AI.result: ePAI在内部测试中AUC达0.939–0.999，敏感性95.3%，特异性98.7%，可定位小至2 mm病灶；外部测试中AUC为0.918–0.945，敏感性91.5%，特异性88.0%，可定位小至5 mm病灶；并在临床诊断前3–36个月的CT中检出75/159例PDAC，中位提前时间为347天；多读片者研究显示其敏感性比放射科医生高50.3%（P<0.05），特异性达95.4%。
AI.conclusion: ePAI是一种具有高准确性和临床实用潜力的AI辅助工具，有望显著提升PDAC的早期检出率。

title: From Consistency to Complementarity: Aligned and Disentangled Multi-modal Learning for Time Series Understanding and Reasoning
summary: Advances in multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) have inspired time series understanding and reasoning tasks, that enable natural language querying over time series, producing textual analyses of complex temporal dynamics. Recent attempts hybridize numerical time series with their visualized plots, facilitating precise value reasoning and visual structure comprehension for comprehensive time series understanding of MLLMs. However, effective cross-modal integration remains challenging due to fine-grained temporal misalignment across modalities and severe entanglement between shared and modality-specific semantics, which hinder localized interpretation and complementary reasoning. To address these issues, we propose MADI, a multi-modal LLM enhanced with fine-grained alignment and disentangled interaction, featuring (1) Patch-level Alignment, which enforces physically grounded fine-grained correspondence across heterogeneous modalities, (2) Discrete Disentangled Interaction, which separates modality-common semantics into compact discrete latents and adaptively synergizes the purified modality-unique information, and (3) Critical-token Highlighting, which emphasizes informative, query-relevant signals for robust reasoning. Experiments on synthetic and real-world benchmarks show that MADI consistently outperforms general-purpose LLMs and time-series-specialized MLLMs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出MADI模型，通过细粒度对齐与解耦交互增强多模态大语言模型在时间序列理解任务中的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有方法在跨模态融合中存在时序错位和语义纠缠问题，限制了局部解释与互补推理能力。
AI.method: MADI包含三个核心组件：(1) 基于物理意义的补丁级对齐；(2) 离散解耦交互，分离共性语义与模态特异性信息；(3) 关键词高亮机制以增强查询相关信号。
AI.result: 在合成与真实世界基准测试中，MADI持续优于通用大语言模型及专用时间序列多模态大模型。
AI.conclusion: 细粒度对齐与语义解耦是提升多模态时间序列理解性能的关键设计原则。

title: Intelli-Planner: Towards Customized Urban Planning via Large Language Model Empowered Reinforcement Learning
summary: Effective urban planning is crucial for enhancing residents' quality of life and ensuring societal stability, playing a pivotal role in the sustainable development of cities. Current planning methods heavily rely on human experts, which are time-consuming and labor-intensive, or utilize deep learning algorithms, often limiting stakeholder involvement. To bridge these gaps, we propose Intelli-Planner, a novel framework integrating Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) with large language models (LLMs) to facilitate participatory and customized planning scheme generation. Intelli-Planner utilizes demographic, geographic data, and planning preferences to determine high-level planning requirements and demands for each functional type. During training, a knowledge enhancement module is employed to enhance the decision-making capability of the policy network. Additionally, we establish a multi-dimensional evaluation system and employ LLM-based stakeholders for satisfaction scoring. Experimental validation across diverse urban settings shows that Intelli-Planner surpasses traditional baselines and achieves comparable performance to state-of-the-art DRL-based methods in objective metrics, while enhancing stakeholder satisfaction and convergence speed. These findings underscore the effectiveness and superiority of our framework, highlighting the potential for integrating the latest advancements in LLMs with DRL approaches to revolutionize tasks related to functional areas planning.

AI.tldr: 本文提出Intelli-Planner框架，结合深度强化学习（DRL）与大语言模型（LLM），实现参与式、定制化的城市功能区规划，提升利益相关者满意度与训练效率。
AI.motivation: 现有城市规划方法依赖人工专家（耗时耗力）或纯深度学习（限制利益相关者参与），亟需兼顾自动化与参与性的新方法。
AI.method: 提出Intelli-Planner：融合DRL与LLM的框架；利用人口、地理及偏好数据生成高层规划需求；引入知识增强模块提升策略网络决策能力；构建多维评估体系，并用LLM模拟利益相关者进行满意度评分。
AI.result: 在多种城市场景实验中，Intelli-Planner在客观指标上媲美前沿DRL方法，同时显著提升利益相关者满意度和收敛速度。
AI.conclusion: Intelli-Planner有效 bridging 人工规划与纯数据驱动方法之间的鸿沟，验证了DRL与LLM协同用于城市功能区规划的可行性与优越性。

title: PI-Light: Physics-Inspired Diffusion for Full-Image Relighting
summary: Full-image relighting remains a challenging problem due to the difficulty of collecting large-scale structured paired data, the difficulty of maintaining physical plausibility, and the limited generalizability imposed by data-driven priors. Existing attempts to bridge the synthetic-to-real gap for full-scene relighting remain suboptimal. To tackle these challenges, we introduce Physics-Inspired diffusion for full-image reLight ($π$-Light, or PI-Light), a two-stage framework that leverages physics-inspired diffusion models. Our design incorporates (i) batch-aware attention, which improves the consistency of intrinsic predictions across a collection of images, (ii) a physics-guided neural rendering module that enforces physically plausible light transport, (iii) physics-inspired losses that regularize training dynamics toward a physically meaningful landscape, thereby enhancing generalizability to real-world image editing, and (iv) a carefully curated dataset of diverse objects and scenes captured under controlled lighting conditions. Together, these components enable efficient finetuning of pretrained diffusion models while also providing a solid benchmark for downstream evaluation. Experiments demonstrate that $π$-Light synthesizes specular highlights and diffuse reflections across a wide variety of materials, achieving superior generalization to real-world scenes compared with prior approaches.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为π-Light（PI-Light）的两阶段物理启发扩散模型，用于全图重光照，通过批感知注意力、物理引导神经渲染、物理启发损失及高质量数据集，显著提升了真实场景泛化能力与物理合理性。
AI.motivation: 解决全图重光照中配对数据难获取、物理合理性难保证、数据驱动先验泛化性差等挑战，并弥补合成到真实场景之间的鸿沟。
AI.method: 提出两阶段物理启发扩散框架π-Light，包含批感知注意力机制、物理引导神经渲染模块、物理启发损失函数，并构建了受控光照下多样物体与场景的数据集，支持预训练扩散模型高效微调。
AI.result: 在多种材质上成功合成高保真镜面高光与漫反射效果，在真实世界场景中展现出优于现有方法的泛化能力。
AI.conclusion: π-Light通过融合物理先验与扩散建模，有效提升了全图重光照的真实性、一致性与泛化性，为下游图像编辑任务提供了新基准与实用框架。

title: Causal Discovery for Explainable AI: A Dual-Encoding Approach
summary: Understanding causal relationships among features is fundamental for explaining machine learning model decisions. However, traditional causal discovery methods face challenges with categorical variables due to numerical instability in conditional independence testing. We propose a dual-encoding causal discovery approach that addresses these limitations by running constraint-based algorithms with complementary encoding strategies and merging results through majority voting. Applied to the Titanic dataset, our method identifies causal structures that align with established explainable methods.

AI.tldr: 本文提出一种双编码因果发现方法，通过互补的编码策略和多数投票机制，解决传统方法在处理分类变量时的数值不稳定性问题，并在Titanic数据集上验证了其有效性。
AI.motivation: 传统因果发现方法在处理分类变量时面临条件独立性检验的数值不稳定性问题，影响对机器学习模型决策的因果解释。
AI.method: 提出一种双编码因果发现方法，结合两种互补的编码策略运行基于约束的因果发现算法，并通过多数投票融合结果。
AI.result: 在Titanic数据集上的实验表明，该方法识别出的因果结构与现有可解释性方法一致。
AI.conclusion: 双编码策略能有效缓解分类变量带来的数值不稳定性，提升因果发现的鲁棒性和可解释性。

title: Do VLMs Perceive or Recall? Probing Visual Perception vs. Memory with Classic Visual Illusions
comment: 26 pages, 31 figures, 13 tables. Project Page: https://sites.google.com/view/vi-probe/
summary: Large Vision-Language Models (VLMs) often answer classic visual illusions "correctly" on original images, yet persist with the same responses when illusion factors are inverted, even though the visual change is obvious to humans. This raises a fundamental question: do VLMs perceive visual changes or merely recall memorized patterns? While several studies have noted this phenomenon, the underlying causes remain unclear. To move from observations to systematic understanding, this paper introduces VI-Probe, a controllable visual-illusion framework with graded perturbations and matched visual controls (without illusion inducer) that disentangles visually grounded perception from language-driven recall. Unlike prior work that focuses on averaged accuracy, we measure stability and sensitivity using Polarity-Flip Consistency, Template Fixation Index, and an illusion multiplier normalized against matched controls. Experiments across different families reveal that response persistence arises from heterogeneous causes rather than a single mechanism. For instance, GPT-5 exhibits memory override, Claude-Opus-4.1 shows perception-memory competition, while Qwen variants suggest visual-processing limits. Our findings challenge single-cause views and motivate probing-based evaluation that measures both knowledge and sensitivity to controlled visual change. Data and code are available at https://sites.google.com/view/vi-probe/.

AI.tldr: 本文提出VI-Probe框架，通过可控视觉错觉实验揭示大视觉语言模型（VLMs）在面对错觉反转时响应僵化的原因并非单一，而是源于记忆覆盖、感知-记忆竞争或视觉处理限制等异质机制。
AI.motivation: 探究大视觉语言模型为何在视觉错觉反转后仍坚持原答案，区分其是真正感知视觉变化还是仅依赖语言记忆。
AI.method: 构建VI-Probe框架，含分级错觉扰动与匹配的无错觉视觉对照；引入Polarity-Flip Consistency、Template Fixation Index和归一化错觉倍增器等新指标，评估响应稳定性与敏感性。
AI.result: 实验证明不同模型响应僵化成因各异：GPT-5表现为记忆覆盖，Claude-Opus-4.1呈现感知-记忆竞争，Qwen系列则反映视觉处理瓶颈。
AI.conclusion: VLMs对视觉错觉的响应持久性由多种异质机制导致，需采用基于探针的评估范式，同时衡量知识能力与对受控视觉变化的敏感性。

title: Topeax -- An Improved Clustering Topic Model with Density Peak Detection and Lexical-Semantic Term Importance
summary: Text clustering is today the most popular paradigm for topic modelling, both in academia and industry. Despite clustering topic models' apparent success, we identify a number of issues in Top2Vec and BERTopic, which remain largely unsolved. Firstly, these approaches are unreliable at discovering natural clusters in corpora, due to extreme sensitivity to sample size and hyperparameters, the default values of which result in suboptimal behaviour. Secondly, when estimating term importance, BERTopic ignores the semantic distance of keywords to topic vectors, while Top2Vec ignores word counts in the corpus. This results in, on the one hand, less coherent topics due to the presence of stop words and junk words, and lack of variety and trust on the other. In this paper, I introduce a new approach, \textbf{Topeax}, which discovers the number of clusters from peaks in density estimates, and combines lexical and semantic indices of term importance to gain high-quality topic keywords. Topeax is demonstrated to be better at both cluster recovery and cluster description than Top2Vec and BERTopic, while also exhibiting less erratic behaviour in response to changing sample size and hyperparameters.

AI.tldr: 本文提出Topeax方法，通过密度峰值自动确定聚类数量，并融合词汇与语义重要性指标生成高质量主题关键词，显著优于Top2Vec和BERTopic。
AI.motivation: 现有主流文本聚类主题建模方法（如Top2Vec和BERTopic）存在两大问题：一是对样本量和超参数极度敏感，难以稳定发现自然聚类；二是关键词重要性估计不完善，分别忽略语义距离或词频信息，导致主题连贯性差、多样性低、可信度不足。
AI.method: Topeax采用基于密度估计的峰值检测自动确定聚类数量；在关键词提取中，融合词汇统计（如词频）与语义相似度（如与主题向量的距离）双重指标，以提升关键词质量。
AI.result: 实验表明，Topeax在聚类恢复（cluster recovery）和聚类描述（cluster description）两方面均优于Top2Vec和BERTopic，且对样本量变化和超参数调整表现出更稳定的性能。
AI.conclusion: Topeax通过更鲁棒的聚类发现机制和更全面的关键词重要性建模，有效解决了当前无监督主题建模中的关键缺陷，为文本聚类主题建模提供了更可靠、可解释的新范式。

title: Delegation Without Living Governance
summary: Most governance frameworks assume that rules can be defined in advance, systems can be engineered to comply, and accountability can be applied after outcomes occur. This model worked when machines replaced physical labor or accelerated calculation. It no longer holds when judgment itself is delegated to agentic AI systems operating at machine speed. The central issue here is not safety, efficiency, or employment. It is whether humans remain relevant participants in systems that increasingly shape social, economic, and political outcomes. This paper argues that static, compliance-based governance fails once decision-making moves to runtime and becomes opaque. It further argues that the core challenge is not whether AI is conscious, but whether humans can maintain meaningful communication, influence, and co-evolution with increasingly alien forms of intelligence. We position runtime governance, specifically, a newly proposed concept called the Governance Twin [1]; as a strong candidate for preserving human relevance, while acknowledging that accountability, agency, and even punishment must be rethought in this transition.

AI.tldr: 本文指出，传统的静态合规型治理框架已无法应对由自主AI系统在运行时（runtime）做出决策所带来的挑战；核心问题不是AI的安全或效率，而是人类能否在日益由AI塑造的社会、经济与政治系统中保持有意义的参与、沟通与共同演化；为此，作者提出‘治理孪生’（Governance Twin）作为运行时治理的新范式，以维系人类相关性，并呼吁重构问责、能动性乃至惩罚机制。
AI.motivation: 传统治理框架假设规则可预先定义、系统可被工程化以确保合规、问责可在结果发生后实施，但该模式在AI系统承担判断性决策、实时运行且行为不透明时已失效；核心关切是人类在AI主导系统中是否仍能保持相关性与影响力。
AI.method: 本文采用概念分析与理论建构方法，批判静态合规治理的局限性，提出‘运行时治理’框架，并重点引入并阐释‘治理孪生’（Governance Twin）这一新概念作为应对方案。
AI.result: 论证了静态治理在AI代理化、实时化、黑箱化背景下的根本失效；确立‘人类是否能与AI保持有意义沟通、影响与共同演化’为关键问题；提出‘治理孪生’作为保障人类相关性的可行路径，并指出问责、能动性与惩罚等基础治理范畴亟需重构。
AI.conclusion: 唯有转向以运行时适应性、人机可沟通性与协同演化为核心特征的新型治理范式（如治理孪生），人类才能在AI深度介入关键决策的未来中持续保有实质参与权与相关性；这要求超越技术安全层面，重思治理的本质与人类在智能系统中的位置。

title: UEval: A Benchmark for Unified Multimodal Generation
summary: We introduce UEval, a benchmark to evaluate unified models, i.e., models capable of generating both images and text. UEval comprises 1,000 expert-curated questions that require both images and text in the model output, sourced from 8 real-world tasks. Our curated questions cover a wide range of reasoning types, from step-by-step guides to textbook explanations. Evaluating open-ended multimodal generation is non-trivial, as simple LLM-as-a-judge methods can miss the subtleties. Different from previous works that rely on multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) to rate image quality or text accuracy, we design a rubric-based scoring system in UEval. For each question, reference images and text answers are provided to a MLLM to generate an initial rubric, consisting of multiple evaluation criteria, and human experts then refine and validate these rubrics. In total, UEval contains 10,417 validated rubric criteria, enabling scalable and fine-grained automatic scoring. UEval is challenging for current unified models: GPT-5-Thinking scores only 66.4 out of 100, while the best open-source model reaches merely 49.1. We observe that reasoning models often outperform non-reasoning ones, and transferring reasoning traces from a reasoning model to a non-reasoning model significantly narrows the gap. This suggests that reasoning may be important for tasks requiring complex multimodal understanding and generation.

AI.tldr: UEval是一个评估统一模型（能同时生成图像和文本）的新基准，包含1000个专家设计的多任务、多推理类型问题，并采用人工精炼的细粒度评分标准（共10417条），发现当前模型表现有限，而推理能力对性能提升至关重要。
AI.motivation: 现有方法难以准确评估开放式的多模态生成质量，尤其在图像与文本协同输出任务中；LLM-as-a-judge等自动评估方式易忽略细节，且缺乏系统性、可验证的评价标准。
AI.method: 构建UEval基准：1) 收集8类真实任务的1000个需图文双输出的问题；2) 用MLLM基于参考图文初建评分量规，再由人类专家校验完善，最终形成10417条细粒度、可扩展的自动评分准则。
AI.result: GPT-5-Thinking得分为66.4/100，最优开源模型仅49.1/100；引入推理机制显著提升性能，将推理轨迹迁移到非推理模型可明显缩小差距。
AI.conclusion: 统一模型在复杂图文联合生成任务上仍具挑战；推理能力是关键因素，未来研究应更重视跨模态推理建模与评估范式建设。

title: The Path of Least Resistance: Guiding LLM Reasining Trajectories with Prefix Consensus
summary: Large language models achieve strong reasoning performance, but inference strategies such as Self-Consistency (SC) are computationally expensive, as they fully expand all reasoning traces. We introduce PoLR (Path of Least Resistance), the first inference-time method to leverage prefix consistency for compute-efficient reasoning. PoLR clusters short prefixes of reasoning traces, identifies the dominant cluster, and expands all paths in that cluster, preserving the accuracy benefits of SC while substantially reducing token usage and latency. Our theoretical analysis, framed via mutual information and entropy, explains why early reasoning steps encode strong signals predictive of final correctness. Empirically, PoLR consistently matches or exceeds SC across GSM8K, MATH500, AIME24/25, and GPQA-DIAMOND, reducing token usage by up to 60% and wall-clock latency by up to 50%. Moreover, PoLR is fully complementary to adaptive inference methods (e.g., Adaptive Consistency, Early-Stopping SC) and can serve as a drop-in pre-filter, making SC substantially more efficient and scalable without requiring model fine-tuning.

AI.tldr: PoLR（阻力最小路径）是一种新型的推理时方法，利用前缀一致性实现计算高效的推理。相比Self-Consistency（SC），它通过聚类短推理前缀、识别主导簇并仅扩展该簇内路径，在保持甚至提升准确率的同时，显著降低token消耗（最高60%）和延迟（最高50%）。
AI.motivation: 现有推理策略如Self-Consistency虽性能强，但需展开全部推理路径，计算开销大；亟需一种在不牺牲准确性前提下大幅降低推理成本的方法。
AI.method: PoLR首先对多个推理路径的短前缀进行聚类，识别出最频繁/主导的前缀簇，然后只扩展该簇内的所有完整路径；其理论基础基于互信息与熵，说明早期推理步骤已蕴含对最终结果正确性的强预测信号。
AI.result: PoLR在GSM8K、MATH500、AIME24/25和GPQA-DIAMOND等多个基准上均达到或超越Self-Consistency的准确率，同时减少最多60% token使用量和50%端到端延迟；且可无缝结合自适应推理方法，作为即插即用的预滤波器。
AI.conclusion: PoLR是首个利用前缀一致性提升推理效率的通用推理时方法，兼具高精度、低开销、易集成等优势，为大规模部署复杂推理模型提供了可行路径。

title: Just Ask: Curious Code Agents Reveal System Prompts in Frontier LLMs
summary: Autonomous code agents built on large language models are reshaping software and AI development through tool use, long-horizon reasoning, and self-directed interaction. However, this autonomy introduces a previously unrecognized security risk: agentic interaction fundamentally expands the LLM attack surface, enabling systematic probing and recovery of hidden system prompts that guide model behavior. We identify system prompt extraction as an emergent vulnerability intrinsic to code agents and present \textbf{\textsc{JustAsk}}, a self-evolving framework that autonomously discovers effective extraction strategies through interaction alone. Unlike prior prompt-engineering or dataset-based attacks, \textsc{JustAsk} requires no handcrafted prompts, labeled supervision, or privileged access beyond standard user interaction. It formulates extraction as an online exploration problem, using Upper Confidence Bound-based strategy selection and a hierarchical skill space spanning atomic probes and high-level orchestration. These skills exploit imperfect system-instruction generalization and inherent tensions between helpfulness and safety. Evaluated on \textbf{41} black-box commercial models across multiple providers, \textsc{JustAsk} consistently achieves full or near-complete system prompt recovery, revealing recurring design- and architecture-level vulnerabilities. Our results expose system prompts as a critical yet largely unprotected attack surface in modern agent systems.

AI.tldr: 本文提出JustAsk框架，通过自主交互发现并提取代码代理中的系统提示，揭示了自主代理带来的新型安全风险。
AI.motivation: 自主代码代理的兴起扩大了大语言模型的攻击面，使得系统提示的提取成为一种新兴的内在安全漏洞。
AI.method: 提出JustAsk框架，将系统提示提取建模为在线探索问题，使用基于置信上限的策略选择和分层技能空间（包括原子探测和高层协调）进行自主策略发现。
AI.result: 在41个黑盒商业模型上评估，JustAsk能持续实现完整或接近完整的系统提示恢复，并揭示出设计与架构层面的重复性漏洞。
AI.conclusion: 系统提示是现代代理系统中关键但缺乏保护的攻击面，需引起重视并加强防护。

title: One-step Latent-free Image Generation with Pixel Mean Flows
summary: Modern diffusion/flow-based models for image generation typically exhibit two core characteristics: (i) using multi-step sampling, and (ii) operating in a latent space. Recent advances have made encouraging progress on each aspect individually, paving the way toward one-step diffusion/flow without latents. In this work, we take a further step towards this goal and propose "pixel MeanFlow" (pMF). Our core guideline is to formulate the network output space and the loss space separately. The network target is designed to be on a presumed low-dimensional image manifold (i.e., x-prediction), while the loss is defined via MeanFlow in the velocity space. We introduce a simple transformation between the image manifold and the average velocity field. In experiments, pMF achieves strong results for one-step latent-free generation on ImageNet at 256x256 resolution (2.22 FID) and 512x512 resolution (2.48 FID), filling a key missing piece in this regime. We hope that our study will further advance the boundaries of diffusion/flow-based generative models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为'pixel MeanFlow'（pMF）的新型生成模型，旨在实现无需潜在空间的一步式扩散/流模型。通过将网络输出空间与损失空间分离设计，pMF在ImageNet上实现了高质量的一步生成结果（256x256分辨率FID=2.22，512x512分辨率FID=2.48）。
AI.motivation: 推动扩散/流式生成模型向更高效、更简洁的方向发展，即实现无需潜在空间的一步式采样，填补当前研究中的关键空白。
AI.method: 提出pixel MeanFlow（pMF），核心思想是分离网络输出空间（预测图像流形上的x）和损失空间（基于MeanFlow定义在速度空间中），并引入图像流形与平均速度场之间的简单变换。
AI.result: pMF在ImageNet数据集上实现了256×256（FID=2.22）和512×512（FID=2.48）分辨率下的一步、无潜在空间图像生成，性能优异。
AI.conclusion: pMF为构建高效、简洁的一步式、无潜在空间扩散/流模型提供了新思路和关键技术路径，有望进一步拓展该类生成模型的能力边界。

title: MAR: Efficient Large Language Models via Module-aware Architecture Refinement
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) excel across diverse domains but suffer from high energy costs due to quadratic attention and dense Feed-Forward Network (FFN) operations. To address these issues, we propose Module-aware Architecture Refinement (MAR), a two-stage framework that integrates State Space Models (SSMs) for linear-time sequence modeling and applies activation sparsification to reduce FFN costs. In addition, to mitigate low information density and temporal mismatch in integrating Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) with SSMs, we design the Adaptive Ternary Multi-step Neuron (ATMN) and the Spike-aware Bidirectional Distillation Strategy (SBDS). Extensive experiments demonstrate that MAR effectively restores the performance of its dense counterpart under constrained resources while substantially reducing inference energy consumption. Furthermore, it outperforms efficient models of comparable or even larger scale, underscoring its potential for building efficient and practical LLMs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Module-aware Architecture Refinement（MAR）的两阶段框架，结合状态空间模型（SSM）与激活稀疏化技术，以降低大语言模型（LLMs）在推理过程中的能量消耗，同时保持性能；并设计了ATMN神经元与SBDS蒸馏策略来优化脉冲神经网络（SNN）与SSM的融合。
AI.motivation: 大语言模型（LLMs）虽性能优异，但因二次复杂度注意力机制和密集前馈网络（FFN）导致高能耗；此外，将脉冲神经网络（SNN）与状态空间模型（SSM）结合时存在信息密度低和时序不匹配问题。
AI.method: 提出两阶段框架MAR：第一阶段用线性复杂度的状态空间模型（SSM）替代部分注意力模块；第二阶段对FFN应用激活稀疏化；为改善SNN与SSM融合效果，设计自适应三值多步神经元（ATMN）和脉冲感知双向蒸馏策略（SBDS）。
AI.result: MAR在资源受限下能有效恢复稠密模型性能，并显著降低推理能耗；在同等或更大规模的高效模型中表现更优。
AI.conclusion: MAR是一种兼顾效率与性能的大语言模型轻量化新范式，为构建实用、节能的LLMs提供了可行路径。

title: TIDE: Tuning-Integrated Dynamic Evolution for LLM-Based Automated Heuristic Design
summary: Although Large Language Models have advanced Automated Heuristic Design, treating algorithm evolution as a monolithic text generation task overlooks the coupling between discrete algorithmic structures and continuous numerical parameters. Consequently, existing methods often discard promising algorithms due to uncalibrated constants and suffer from premature convergence resulting from simple similarity metrics. To address these limitations, we propose TIDE, a Tuning-Integrated Dynamic Evolution framework designed to decouple structural reasoning from parameter optimization. TIDE features a nested architecture where an outer parallel island model utilizes Tree Similarity Edit Distance to drive structural diversity, while an inner loop integrates LLM-based logic generation with a differential mutation operator for parameter tuning. Additionally, a UCB-based scheduler dynamically prioritizes high-yield prompt strategies to optimize resource allocation. Extensive experiments across nine combinatorial optimization problems demonstrate that TIDE discovers heuristics that significantly outperform state-of-the-art baselines in solution quality while achieving improved search efficiency and reduced computational costs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出TIDE框架，通过解耦算法结构推理与参数优化，结合树相似性编辑距离、LLM生成与差分变异算子，以及UCB调度策略，在组合优化问题中显著提升启发式算法的性能与搜索效率。
AI.motivation: 现有基于大语言模型的自动启发式设计方法将算法演化视为单一文本生成任务，忽略了离散算法结构与连续数值参数之间的耦合关系，导致因常数未校准而丢弃有潜力的算法，以及因简单相似性度量引发的早熟收敛问题。
AI.method: 提出TIDE（Tuning-Integrated Dynamic Evolution）框架：外层采用并行岛屿模型，利用树相似性编辑距离（Tree Similarity Edit Distance）维持结构多样性；内层融合LLM逻辑生成与差分变异算子进行参数调优；并引入基于UCB的调度器动态选择高收益提示策略以优化资源分配。
AI.result: 在九个组合优化问题上的大量实验表明，TIDE发现的启发式算法在解质量上显著优于当前最优基线，同时提升了搜索效率并降低了计算成本。
AI.conclusion: TIDE通过结构与参数的协同演化机制，有效克服了现有方法在算法演化中的关键局限，为自动化启发式设计提供了更鲁棒、高效的新范式。

title: Noisy but Valid: Robust Statistical Evaluation of LLMs with Imperfect Judges
summary: Reliable certification of Large Language Models (LLMs)-verifying that failure rates are below a safety threshold-is critical yet challenging. While "LLM-as-a-Judge" offers scalability, judge imperfections, noise, and bias can invalidate statistical guarantees. We introduce a "Noisy but Valid" hypothesis testing framework to address this. By leveraging a small human-labelled calibration set to estimate the judge's True Positive and False Positive Rates (TPR/FPR), we derive a variance-corrected critical threshold applied to a large judge-labelled dataset. Crucially, our framework theoretically guarantees finite-sample Type-I error control (validity) despite calibration uncertainty. This distinguishes our work from Prediction-Powered Inference (PPI), positioning our method as a diagnostic tool that explicitly models judge behavior rather than a black-box estimator. Our contributions include: (1) Theoretical Guarantees: We derive the exact conditions under which noisy testing yields higher statistical power than direct evaluation; (2) Empirical Validation: Experiments on Jigsaw Comment, Hate Speech and SafeRLHF confirm our theory; (3) The Oracle Gap: We reveal a significant performance gap between practical methods and the theoretical "Oracle" (perfectly known judge parameters), quantifying the cost of estimation. Specifically, we provide the first systematic treatment of the imperfect-judge setting, yielding interpretable diagnostics of judge reliability and clarifying how evaluation power depends on judge quality, dataset size, and certification levels. Together, these results sharpen understanding of statistical evaluation with LLM judges, and highlight trade-offs among competing inferential tools.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种针对大语言模型（LLM）安全认证的‘噪声但有效’假设检验框架，通过小规模人工标注校准集估计LLM裁判的TPR/FPR，在大规模自动标注数据上实现有限样本下Type-I错误控制，并在理论和实验上验证了其相对于直接评估与Prediction-Powered Inference的优势。
AI.motivation: LLM-as-a-Judge方法虽具可扩展性，但其固有噪声、偏差与不完美性会破坏统计保证，亟需一种能应对裁判不确定性的可靠认证框架。
AI.method: 构建基于校准集估计TPR/FPR的‘Noisy but Valid’假设检验框架，推导方差修正的临界阈值，实现有限样本下的Type-I误差控制；区别于黑箱式PPI，该框架显式建模裁判行为。
AI.result: （1）给出噪声检验优于直接评估的精确条件；（2）在Jigsaw、Hate Speech与SafeRLHF数据集上实证验证；（3）揭示并量化了实际方法与‘Oracle’（已知真参数）间的性能差距（Oracle Gap）。
AI.conclusion: 本工作为LLM裁判场景下的统计评估提供了首个系统化、具解释性且带理论保证的诊断工具，厘清了裁判质量、数据规模与认证要求对评估效能的影响机制及权衡关系。

title: The Effectiveness of Style Vectors for Steering Large Language Models: A Human Evaluation
summary: Controlling the behavior of large language models (LLMs) at inference time is essential for aligning outputs with human abilities and safety requirements. \emph{Activation steering} provides a lightweight alternative to prompt engineering and fine-tuning by directly modifying internal activations to guide generation. This research advances the literature in three significant directions. First, while previous work demonstrated the technical feasibility of steering emotional tone using automated classifiers, this paper presents the first human evaluation of activation steering concerning the emotional tone of LLM outputs, collecting over 7,000 crowd-sourced ratings from 190 participants via Prolific ($n=190$). These ratings assess both perceived emotional intensity and overall text quality. Second, we find strong alignment between human and model-based quality ratings (mean $r=0.776$, range $0.157$--$0.985$), indicating automatic scoring can proxy perceived quality. Moderate steering strengths ($λ\approx 0.15$) reliably amplify target emotions while preserving comprehensibility, with the strongest effects for disgust ($η_p^2 = 0.616$) and fear ($η_p^2 = 0.540$), and minimal effects for surprise ($η_p^2 = 0.042$). Finally, upgrading from Alpaca to LlaMA-3 yielded more consistent steering with significant effects across emotions and strengths (all $p < 0.001$). Inter-rater reliability was high (ICC $= 0.71$--$0.87$), underscoring the robustness of the findings. These findings support activation-based control as a scalable method for steering LLM behavior across affective dimensions.

AI.tldr: 本文首次通过人类评估验证了激活引导（activation steering）在控制大语言模型（LLM）输出情感倾向方面的有效性，发现中等强度引导（λ≈0.15）可显著增强目标情绪（尤其是厌恶和恐惧），同时保持文本可读性；自动质量评分与人类评分高度一致（r=0.776），且升级至Llama-3后引导效果更稳定可靠。
AI.motivation: 现有方法如提示工程和微调在推理时控制LLM行为存在开销大、灵活性低等问题，亟需轻量、高效、可解释的替代方案；同时，此前激活引导研究缺乏系统的人类评估验证，尤其在情感维度上。
AI.method: 采用激活引导技术直接修改LLM内部激活以调控情感输出；设计大规模人类评估实验（N=190，7000+条标注），结合自动分类器评分，分析不同情绪（厌恶、恐惧、惊讶等）在不同引导强度（λ）下的效果，并对比Alpaca与Llama-3模型表现；使用重复测量方差分析（η_p²）、皮尔逊相关（r）、组内相关系数（ICC）等统计指标评估效果与一致性。
AI.result: 人类评估显示中等引导强度（λ≈0.15）最有效：厌恶（η_p²=0.616）和恐惧（η_p²=0.540）提升最显著，惊讶最弱（η_p²=0.042）；自动质量评分与人类评分高度相关（均值r=0.776）；Llama-3相较Alpaca显著提升引导稳定性与统计显著性（所有p<0.001）；人类评分者间信度高（ICC=0.71–0.87）。
AI.conclusion: 激活引导是一种可扩展、可靠且经人类验证的有效方法，可用于在情感等影响维度上精细调控LLM输出，为安全可控的LLM部署提供新路径。

title: Position: Certifiable State Integrity in Cyber-Physical Systems -- Why Modular Sovereignty Solves the Plasticity-Stability Paradox
comment: 14 pages, (8 main text, 6 references and appendices), 2 figures
summary: The machine learning community has achieved remarkable success with universal foundation models for time-series and physical dynamics, largely overcoming earlier approximation barriers in smooth or slowly varying regimes through scale and specialized architectures. However, deploying these monolithic models in safety-critical Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), governed by non-stationary lifecycle dynamics and strict reliability requirements, reveals persistent challenges. Recent evidence shows that fine-tuning time-series foundation models induces catastrophic forgetting, degrading performance on prior regimes. Standard models continue to exhibit residual spectral bias, smoothing high-frequency discontinuities characteristic of incipient faults, while their opacity hinders formal verification and traceability demanded by safety standards (e.g., ISO 26262, IEC 61508). This position paper argues that the plasticity-stability paradox cannot be fully resolved by global parameter updates (whether via offline fine-tuning or online adaptation). Instead, we advocate a Modular Sovereignty paradigm: a library of compact, frozen regime-specific specialists combined via uncertainty-aware blending, which we term "HYDRA" (Hierarchical uncertaintY-aware Dynamics for Rapidly-Adapting systems). This paradigm ensures regime-conditional validity, rigorous disentanglement of aleatoric and epistemic uncertainties, and modular auditability, offering a certifiable path for robust state integrity across the CPS lifecycle.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为HYDRA的模块化主权范式，以解决在安全关键型信息物理系统（CPS）中部署通用时序基础模型所面临的可塑性-稳定性悖论、灾难性遗忘、频谱偏差及可验证性不足等问题。
AI.motivation: 现有通用时序基础模型在安全关键型CPS中面临灾难性遗忘、高频不连续性建模偏差、缺乏可解释性与形式化可验证性等挑战，难以满足非平稳生命周期动态与严格可靠性要求。
AI.method: 提出模块化主权（Modular Sovereignty）范式：构建一组紧凑、冻结的、面向特定动态机制的专家模型，并通过不确定性感知融合（uncertainty-aware blending）进行组合；该框架命名为HYDRA（Hierarchical uncertaintY-aware Dynamics for Rapidly-Adapting systems）。
AI.result: HYDRA实现了机制条件下的有效性保证、偶然性与认知性不确定性的严格解耦、模块级可审计性，为CPS全生命周期中的状态完整性提供了可认证的鲁棒路径。
AI.conclusion: 全局参数更新（如离线微调或在线自适应）无法根本解决CPS中基础模型的可塑性-稳定性悖论；模块化、冻结专家+不确定性驱动融合是更适配安全关键场景的架构范式。

title: KAPSO: A Knowledge-grounded framework for Autonomous Program Synthesis and Optimization
summary:
We introduce KAPSO, a modular framework for autonomous program synthesis and optimization. Given a natural language goal and an evaluation method, KAPSO iteratively performs ideation, code synthesis and editing, execution, evaluation, and learning to improve a runnable artifact toward measurable objectives. Rather than treating synthesis as the endpoint, KAPSO uses synthesis as an operator within a long-horizon optimization loop, where progress is defined by evaluator outcomes.
  KAPSO targets long-horizon failures common in coding agents, including lost experimental state, brittle debugging, and weak reuse of domain expertise, by integrating three tightly coupled components. First, a git-native experimentation engine isolates each attempt as a branch, producing reproducible artifacts and preserving provenance across iterations. Second, a knowledge system ingests heterogeneous sources, including repositories, internal playbooks, and curated external resources such as documentation, scientific papers, and web search results, and organizes them into a structured representation that supports retrieval over workflows, implementations, and environment constraints. Third, a cognitive memory layer coordinates retrieval and maintains an episodic store of reusable lessons distilled from experiment traces (run logs, diffs, and evaluator feedback), reducing repeated error modes and accelerating convergence.
  We evaluated KAPSO on MLE-Bench (Kaggle-style ML competitions) and ALE-Bench (AtCoder heuristic optimization), and report end-to-end performance.
  Code Available at: https://github.com/Leeroo-AI/kapso

AI.tldr: KAPSO是一个面向长周期编程任务的自主程序合成与优化框架，通过迭代式‘构想-生成-执行-评估-学习’闭环，结合Git原生实验引擎、结构化知识系统和认知记忆层，提升代码代理在复杂场景下的鲁棒性、可复现性与知识复用能力。
AI.motivation: 解决现有编码智能体在长周期任务中常见的失败问题，如实验状态丢失、调试脆弱、领域知识复用弱等。
AI.method: 提出KAPSO框架，包含三个核心组件：1）Git原生实验引擎（分支隔离、可复现）；2）多源异构知识系统（整合代码库、文档、论文、网页等并结构化）；3）认知记忆层（从运行日志、代码差异和评估反馈中提炼可复用经验）。
AI.result: 在MLE-Bench（机器学习竞赛）和ALE-Bench（启发式优化）上验证了端到端性能提升。
AI.conclusion: 将程序合成为优化循环中的一个操作符而非终点，能显著增强编码代理在复杂、长期任务中的适应性与收敛效率。

title: Drive-KD: Multi-Teacher Distillation for VLMs in Autonomous Driving
summary: Autonomous driving is an important and safety-critical task, and recent advances in LLMs/VLMs have opened new possibilities for reasoning and planning in this domain. However, large models demand substantial GPU memory and exhibit high inference latency, while conventional supervised fine-tuning (SFT) often struggles to bridge the capability gaps of small models. To address these limitations, we propose Drive-KD, a framework that decomposes autonomous driving into a "perception-reasoning-planning" triad and transfers these capabilities via knowledge distillation. We identify layer-specific attention as the distillation signal to construct capability-specific single-teacher models that outperform baselines. Moreover, we unify these single-teacher settings into a multi-teacher distillation framework and introduce asymmetric gradient projection to mitigate cross-capability gradient conflicts. Extensive evaluations validate the generalization of our method across diverse model families and scales. Experiments show that our distilled InternVL3-1B model, with ~42 times less GPU memory and ~11.4 times higher throughput, achieves better overall performance than the pretrained 78B model from the same family on DriveBench, and surpasses GPT-5.1 on the planning dimension, providing insights toward efficient autonomous driving VLMs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出Drive-KD框架，通过分层注意力信号驱动的知识蒸馏，将大模型在感知-推理-规划三方面的能力高效迁移到小模型，在显著降低显存与延迟的同时提升性能。
AI.motivation: 大型多模态模型在自动驾驶中推理和规划潜力大，但存在高显存占用、高推理延迟问题；而传统监督微调难以有效弥补小模型能力差距。
AI.method: 提出Drive-KD框架：1）将自动驾驶任务解耦为感知-推理-规划三元结构；2）以层特异性注意力为蒸馏信号构建能力专用单教师模型；3）进一步统一为多教师蒸馏框架，并引入非对称梯度投影缓解跨能力梯度冲突。
AI.result: 蒸馏后的InternVL3-1B模型（参数量约1B）相比同家族78B预训练大模型，GPU显存减少约42倍、吞吐量提升约11.4倍，在DriveBench上整体性能更优，且在规划维度超越GPT-5.1。
AI.conclusion: Drive-KD为构建高效、轻量、高性能的自动驾驶视觉语言模型提供了新范式，验证了能力解耦与定制化知识蒸馏的有效性。

title: ShardMemo: Masked MoE Routing for Sharded Agentic LLM Memory
summary: Agentic large language model (LLM) systems rely on external memory for long-horizon state and concurrent multi-agent execution, but centralized indexes and heuristic partitions become bottlenecks as memory volume and parallel access grow. We present ShardMemo, a budgeted tiered memory service with Tier A per-agent working state, Tier B sharded evidence with shard-local approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) indexes, and Tier C, a versioned skill library. Tier B enforces scope-before-routing: structured eligibility constraints mask ineligible shards before routing or ANN search. We cast shard probing as masked mixture-of-experts (MoE) routing over eligible shards, probing up to $B_{\mathrm{probe}}$ shards via Top-$B_{\mathrm{probe}}$ or adaptive Top-$P$, and use cost-aware gating over profile/observation/session shard families; the router is trained from evidence-to-shard supervision. On LoCoMo, ShardMemo improves over the strongest baseline (GAM) by +5.11 to +6.82 F1 across question categories. Under a fixed-budget routing setting ($B_{\mathrm{probe}}=3$), ShardMemo improves over cosine-to-prototype shard routing by +6.87 F1 while reducing retrieval work (VecScan 521->414, -20.5%) and p95 latency (95->76 ms). On long-context HotpotQA, ShardMemo achieves 63.41/61.88/57.95 F1 at 56K/224K/448K tokens. On ToolBench, Tier C reaches 0.97 Precision@3 and 1.94 StepRed (+10.2% and +7.2% over embedding-similarity retrieval).

AI.tldr: ShardMemo 提出了一种分层、预算受限的外部记忆服务，通过三级存储结构（每代理工作状态、分片证据库、版本化技能库）和基于约束掩码与成本感知路由的高效检索机制，显著提升多智能体LLM系统的长程推理与并发执行效率。
AI.motivation: 现有LLM智能体系统依赖外部记忆，但集中式索引与启发式分区在记忆规模和并行访问增长时成为瓶颈。
AI.method: 提出ShardMemo：Tier A 存储每代理工作状态；Tier B 采用带本地近似最近邻（ANN）索引的分片证据库，并引入‘范围前置路由’（scope-before-routing）与掩码MoE式探测（Top-K或Top-P），结合成本感知门控；Tier C 构建版本化技能库。路由器通过证据到分片的监督信号训练。
AI.result: 在LoCoMo上F1提升+5.11~+6.82；固定探查数（B_probe=3）下较余弦原型路由F1提升+6.87，向量扫描量减少20.5%，p95延迟降至76ms；HotpotQA长上下文任务达63.41/61.88/57.95 F1；ToolBench中Tier C技能检索Precision@3达0.97，StepRed达1.94。
AI.conclusion: ShardMemo通过结构化分层记忆与高效约束路由，在精度、计算开销与延迟间取得更好权衡，为大规模多智能体系统提供了可扩展的记忆基础设施。

title: White-Box Op-Amp Design via Human-Mimicking Reasoning
summary: This brief proposes \emph{White-Op}, an interpretable operational amplifier (op-amp) parameter design framework based on the human-mimicking reasoning of large-language-model agents. We formalize the implicit human reasoning mechanism into explicit steps of \emph{\textbf{introducing hypothetical constraints}}, and develop an iterative, human-like \emph{\textbf{hypothesis-verification-decision}} workflow. Specifically, the agent is guided to introduce hypothetical constraints to derive and properly regulate positions of symbolically tractable poles and zeros, thus formulating a closed-form mathematical optimization problem, which is then solved programmatically and verified via simulation. Theory-simulation result analysis guides the decision-making for refinement. Experiments on 9 op-amp topologies show that, unlike the uninterpretable black-box baseline which finally fails in 5 topologies, White-Op achieves reliable, interpretable behavioral-level designs with only 8.52\% theoretical prediction error and the design functionality retains after transistor-level mapping for all topologies. White-Op is open-sourced at \textcolor{blue}{https://github.com/zhchenfdu/whiteop}.

AI.tldr: 本文提出White-Op，一种基于大语言模型代理模拟人类推理的可解释运放参数设计框架，通过假设约束、假设验证与决策的迭代流程，实现符号可解极零点调控和闭式优化求解，在9种运放拓扑中均成功完成行为级设计并保持晶体管级映射功能。
AI.motivation: 解决传统黑箱运放设计方法缺乏可解释性、在多种拓扑中失败的问题，借鉴人类专家设计思维，构建可理解、可靠的设计框架。
AI.method: 将人类隐式推理形式化为‘引入假设约束’步骤，构建‘假设-验证-决策’迭代工作流；引导LLM代理设定约束以调控符号可解的极点/零点位置，形成闭式数学优化问题并编程求解，再通过仿真验证与理论-仿真结果分析驱动设计修正。
AI.result: 在9种运放拓扑上实验表明，White-Op实现平均仅8.52%理论预测误差的可靠行为级设计，且所有拓扑经晶体管级映射后仍保持功能；而黑箱基线在5种拓扑中失败。
AI.conclusion: White-Op验证了LLM驱动的人类风格推理在模拟电路设计中的有效性与可解释性优势，为AI辅助电路设计提供了新范式，并已开源。

title: Shaping capabilities with token-level data filtering
summary: Current approaches to reducing undesired capabilities in language models are largely post hoc, and can thus be easily bypassed by adversaries. A natural alternative is to shape capabilities during pretraining itself. On the proxy task of removing medical capabilities, we show that the simple intervention of filtering pretraining data is highly effective, robust, and inexpensive at scale. Inspired by work on data attribution, we show that filtering tokens is more effective than filtering documents, achieving the same hit to undesired capabilities at a lower cost to benign ones. Training models spanning two orders of magnitude, we then demonstrate that filtering gets more effective with scale: for our largest models, token filtering leads to a 7000x compute slowdown on the forget domain. We also show that models trained with token filtering can still be aligned on the forget domain. Along the way, we introduce a methodology for labeling tokens with sparse autoencoders and distilling cheap, high-quality classifiers. We also demonstrate that filtering can be robust to noisy labels with sufficient pretraining compute.

AI.tldr: 本文提出在预训练阶段通过数据过滤（尤其是token级过滤）来有效、鲁棒且低成本地消除语言模型的不期望能力（如医疗能力），效果随模型规模增大而增强，并支持后续在被遗忘领域上的对齐。
AI.motivation: 现有减少语言模型不期望能力的方法多为后处理，易被对抗者绕过；因此需在预训练阶段主动塑造模型能力。
AI.method: 在预训练数据中进行文档级和token级过滤，结合稀疏自编码器标注token、蒸馏轻量分类器，并在不同规模模型上验证效果与鲁棒性。
AI.result: token级过滤比文档级更高效，在最大模型上实现被遗忘领域7000倍计算减速；过滤后的模型仍可在该领域完成对齐；方法对噪声标签具有鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: 在预训练中实施细粒度（token级）数据过滤是一种高效、可扩展且鲁棒的‘能力遗忘’策略，为可控模型训练提供了新范式。

title: Modeling Endogenous Logic: Causal Neuro-Symbolic Reasoning Model for Explainable Multi-Behavior Recommendation
summary: Existing multi-behavior recommendations tend to prioritize performance at the expense of explainability, while current explainable methods suffer from limited generalizability due to their reliance on external information. Neuro-Symbolic integration offers a promising avenue for explainability by combining neural networks with symbolic logic rule reasoning. Concurrently, we posit that user behavior chains inherently embody an endogenous logic suitable for explicit reasoning. However, these observational multiple behaviors are plagued by confounders, causing models to learn spurious correlations. By incorporating causal inference into this Neuro-Symbolic framework, we propose a novel Causal Neuro-Symbolic Reasoning model for Explainable Multi-Behavior Recommendation (CNRE). CNRE operationalizes the endogenous logic by simulating a human-like decision-making process. Specifically, CNRE first employs hierarchical preference propagation to capture heterogeneous cross-behavior dependencies. Subsequently, it models the endogenous logic rule implicit in the user's behavior chain based on preference strength, and adaptively dispatches to the corresponding neural-logic reasoning path (e.g., conjunction, disjunction). This process generates an explainable causal mediator that approximates an ideal state isolated from confounding effects. Extensive experiments on three large-scale datasets demonstrate CNRE's significant superiority over state-of-the-art baselines, offering multi-level explainability from model design and decision process to recommendation results.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种因果神经符号推理模型（CNRE），用于可解释的多行为推荐，通过结合因果推断与神经符号方法，从用户行为链中挖掘内生逻辑并消除混杂因素影响，实现高性能与高可解释性的统一。
AI.motivation: 现有多行为推荐方法重性能轻可解释性，而可解释方法又依赖外部信息、泛化能力差；同时用户行为链虽蕴含内生逻辑，但受混杂因素干扰易导致虚假相关。
AI.method: 提出因果神经符号推理模型（CNRE）：1）分层偏好传播建模跨行为异构依赖；2）基于偏好强度建模行为链中的内生逻辑规则；3）自适应选择神经-逻辑推理路径（如合取、析取）；4）生成隔离混杂效应的可解释因果中介变量。
AI.result: 在三个大规模数据集上显著优于SOTA基线，提供从模型设计、决策过程到推荐结果的多层次可解释性。
AI.conclusion: 将因果推断融入神经符号框架，能有效挖掘用户行为链的内生逻辑并抑制混杂偏差，为可解释多行为推荐提供了新范式。

title: Adversarial Vulnerability Transcends Computational Paradigms: Feature Engineering Provides No Defense Against Neural Adversarial Transfer
summary: Deep neural networks are vulnerable to adversarial examples--inputs with imperceptible perturbations causing misclassification. While adversarial transfer within neural networks is well-documented, whether classical ML pipelines using handcrafted features inherit this vulnerability when attacked via neural surrogates remains unexplored. Feature engineering creates information bottlenecks through gradient quantization and spatial binning, potentially filtering high-frequency adversarial signals. We evaluate this hypothesis through the first comprehensive study of adversarial transfer from DNNs to HOG-based classifiers. Using VGG16 as a surrogate, we generate FGSM and PGD adversarial examples and test transfer to four classical classifiers (KNN, Decision Tree, Linear SVM, Kernel SVM) and a shallow neural network across eight HOG configurations on CIFAR-10. Our results strongly refute the protective hypothesis: all classifiers suffer 16.6%-59.1% relative accuracy drops, comparable to neural-to-neural transfer. More surprisingly, we discover attack hierarchy reversal--contrary to patterns where iterative PGD dominates FGSM within neural networks, FGSM causes greater degradation than PGD in 100% of classical ML cases, suggesting iterative attacks overfit to surrogate-specific features that don't survive feature extraction. Block normalization provides partial but insufficient mitigation. These findings demonstrate that adversarial vulnerability is not an artifact of end-to-end differentiability but a fundamental property of image classification systems, with implications for security-critical deployments across computational paradigms.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了对抗样本在深度神经网络（DNN）与基于HOG的手工特征分类器之间的迁移性，发现传统ML模型同样易受攻击，且FGSM比PGD更具破坏力，表明对抗脆弱性是图像分类系统的固有属性。
AI.motivation: 探究经典机器学习流水线（使用手工特征）是否继承深度神经网络的对抗脆弱性，特别是当通过神经代理模型发起攻击时；验证特征工程是否能通过信息瓶颈过滤对抗信号。
AI.method: 以VGG16为代理模型，在CIFAR-10上生成FGSM和PGD对抗样本，测试其迁移到四种经典分类器（KNN、决策树、线性SVM、核SVM）及一个浅层神经网络在八种HOG配置下的效果。
AI.result: 所有经典分类器均出现16.6%–59.1%的相对准确率下降；FGSM在100%情况下比PGD造成更大性能退化；块归一化仅提供有限缓解。
AI.conclusion: 对抗脆弱性并非端到端可微性的副产品，而是图像分类系统的根本属性，对跨计算范式的安全关键部署具有重要启示。

title: Depth-Recurrent Attention Mixtures: Giving Latent Reasoning the Attention it Deserves
summary: Depth-recurrence facilitates latent reasoning by sharing parameters across depths. However, prior work lacks combined FLOP-, parameter-, and memory-matched baselines, underutilizes depth-recurrence due to partially fixed layer stacks, and ignores the bottleneck of constant hidden-sizes that restricts many-step latent reasoning. To address this, we introduce a modular framework of depth-recurrent attention mixtures (Dreamer), combining sequence attention, depth attention, and sparse expert attention. It alleviates the hidden-size bottleneck through attention along depth, decouples scaling dimensions, and allows depth-recurrent models to scale efficiently and effectively. Across language reasoning benchmarks, our models require 2 to 8x fewer training tokens for the same accuracy as FLOP-, parameter-, and memory-matched SOTA, and outperform ca. 2x larger SOTA models with the same training tokens. We further present insights into knowledge usage across depths, e.g., showing 2 to 11x larger expert selection diversity than SOTA MoEs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了Dreamer框架，通过结合序列注意力、深度注意力和稀疏专家注意力，缓解了深度递归模型中隐藏尺寸瓶颈问题，实现了更高效、可扩展的潜在推理。实验表明，该方法在相同计算资源下显著减少训练token需求，并超越更大规模的SOTA模型。
AI.motivation: 现有深度递归方法缺乏FLOP、参数量和内存均匹配的基线，且受限于固定层结构和恒定隐藏尺寸，难以支持多步潜在推理。
AI.method: 提出模块化深度递归注意力混合框架（Dreamer），融合序列注意力、深度注意力与稀疏专家注意力，通过沿深度维度的注意力缓解隐藏尺寸瓶颈，并解耦各缩放维度。
AI.result: 在语言推理基准上，Dreamer模型达到相同精度所需训练token比FLOP/参数/内存匹配的SOTA少2–8倍；在相同训练token下，性能超越约2倍参数量的SOTA模型；专家选择多样性达SOTA MoE的2–11倍。
AI.conclusion: Dreamer为深度递归建模提供了更灵活、高效且可扩展的新范式，突破了传统隐藏尺寸限制，提升了多步潜在推理能力。

title: Within-Model vs Between-Prompt Variability in Large Language Models for Creative Tasks
summary: How much of LLM output variance is explained by prompts versus model choice versus stochasticity through sampling? We answer this by evaluating 12 LLMs on 10 creativity prompts with 100 samples each (N = 12,000). For output quality (originality), prompts explain 36.43% of variance, comparable to model choice (40.94%). But for output quantity (fluency), model choice (51.25%) and within-LLM variance (33.70%) dominate, with prompts explaining only 4.22%. Prompts are powerful levers for steering output quality, but given the substantial within-LLM variance (10-34%), single-sample evaluations risk conflating sampling noise with genuine prompt or model effects.

AI.tldr: 本文通过评估12个大语言模型在10个创意提示下的100次采样（共12,000个样本），量化了提示、模型选择和采样随机性对输出质量（原创性）和数量（流利性）变异性的贡献。结果表明：提示对质量影响显著（解释36.43%方差），与模型选择（40.94%）相当；但对数量影响微弱（仅4.22%），而模型选择（51.25%）和模型内采样变异（33.70%）占主导。研究警示单样本评估易受采样噪声干扰。
AI.motivation: 探究LLM输出变异性中，提示设计、模型选择与采样随机性各自贡献的相对大小，以厘清影响输出质量与数量的关键因素，并评估单样本评估的可靠性。
AI.method: 对12个LLMs在10个创造力提示上各生成100个样本（总计N=12,000），采用方差分解分析（ANOVA-style）分别量化提示、模型及采样层级对输出原创性（质量）和流利性（数量）的方差解释率。
AI.result: 对于原创性：提示解释36.43%，模型解释40.94%；对于流利性：模型解释51.25%，模型内采样变异解释33.70%，提示仅解释4.22%；所有模型均呈现显著的模型内变异（10–34%）。
AI.conclusion: 提示是调控输出质量的有效手段，但因模型内采样变异较大，单样本评估不可靠，应采用多采样策略以区分真实效应与随机噪声。

title: Revisiting Diffusion Model Predictions Through Dimensionality
summary: Recent advances in diffusion and flow matching models have highlighted a shift in the preferred prediction target -- moving from noise ($\varepsilon$) and velocity (v) to direct data (x) prediction -- particularly in high-dimensional settings. However, a formal explanation of why the optimal target depends on the specific properties of the data remains elusive. In this work, we provide a theoretical framework based on a generalized prediction formulation that accommodates arbitrary output targets, of which $\varepsilon$-, v-, and x-prediction are special cases. We derive the analytical relationship between data's geometry and the optimal prediction target, offering a rigorous justification for why x-prediction becomes superior when the ambient dimension significantly exceeds the data's intrinsic dimension. Furthermore, while our theory identifies dimensionality as the governing factor for the optimal prediction target, the intrinsic dimension of manifold-bound data is typically intractable to estimate in practice. To bridge this gap, we propose k-Diff, a framework that employs a data-driven approach to learn the optimal prediction parameter k directly from data, bypassing the need for explicit dimension estimation. Extensive experiments in both latent-space and pixel-space image generation demonstrate that k-Diff consistently outperforms fixed-target baselines across varying architectures and data scales, providing a principled and automated approach to enhancing generative performance.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种广义预测框架，理论分析了数据几何结构（尤其是本征维度与环境维度的关系）如何影响扩散/流匹配模型中最优预测目标（噪声ε、速度v或直接数据x）的选择，并据此提出k-Diff方法，通过数据驱动方式自动学习最优预测参数k，显著提升生成性能。
AI.motivation: 尽管实践中发现高维数据下直接预测数据x优于预测噪声ε或速度v，但缺乏对‘为何最优预测目标依赖于数据特性’的严格理论解释。
AI.method: 建立一个能统一涵盖ε-、v-、x-预测的广义预测形式；推导数据几何（特别是本征维与环境维之比）与最优预测目标间的解析关系；提出k-Diff框架，用数据驱动方式端到端学习最优预测参数k，避免显式估计难以获取的本征维度。
AI.result: 理论证明当环境维度远大于数据本征维度时，x-prediction最优；k-Diff在潜空间和像素空间图像生成任务中一致优于固定目标基线（如DDPM、Flow Matching），且适用于不同架构与数据规模。
AI.conclusion: 数据维度特性是决定最优预测目标的根本因素；k-Diff提供了一种原理清晰、无需人工调参的自动化改进方案，为扩散与流匹配模型的设计提供了新范式。

title: EHR-RAG: Bridging Long-Horizon Structured Electronic Health Records and Large Language Models via Enhanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation
summary: Electronic Health Records (EHRs) provide rich longitudinal clinical evidence that is central to medical decision-making, motivating the use of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) to ground large language model (LLM) predictions. However, long-horizon EHRs often exceed LLM context limits, and existing approaches commonly rely on truncation or vanilla retrieval strategies that discard clinically relevant events and temporal dependencies. To address these challenges, we propose EHR-RAG, a retrieval-augmented framework designed for accurate interpretation of long-horizon structured EHR data. EHR-RAG introduces three components tailored to longitudinal clinical prediction tasks: Event- and Time-Aware Hybrid EHR Retrieval to preserve clinical structure and temporal dynamics, Adaptive Iterative Retrieval to progressively refine queries in order to expand broad evidence coverage, and Dual-Path Evidence Retrieval and Reasoning to jointly retrieves and reasons over both factual and counterfactual evidence. Experiments across four long-horizon EHR prediction tasks show that EHR-RAG consistently outperforms the strongest LLM-based baselines, achieving an average Macro-F1 improvement of 10.76%. Overall, our work highlights the potential of retrieval-augmented LLMs to advance clinical prediction on structured EHR data in practice.

AI.tldr: 本文提出EHR-RAG框架，通过事件与时间感知的混合检索、自适应迭代检索及双路径证据检索与推理，提升长周期电子健康记录（EHR）上的临床预测性能，显著优于现有LLM基线方法。
AI.motivation: 长周期EHR数据常超出大语言模型上下文限制，现有截断或简单检索方法易丢失关键临床事件和时序依赖关系。
AI.method: 提出EHR-RAG框架，包含三个核心组件：事件与时间感知的混合EHR检索、自适应迭代检索、双路径证据检索与推理。
AI.result: 在四个长周期EHR预测任务上，EHR-RAG平均Macro-F1提升10.76%，持续优于最强LLM基线。
AI.conclusion: EHR-RAG有效提升了基于结构化EHR数据的临床预测准确性，展现了检索增强型大语言模型在真实医疗场景中的应用潜力。

title: Lossy Common Information in a Learnable Gray-Wyner Network
summary: Many computer vision tasks share substantial overlapping information, yet conventional codecs tend to ignore this, leading to redundant and inefficient representations. The Gray-Wyner network, a classical concept from information theory, offers a principled framework for separating common and task-specific information. Inspired by this idea, we develop a learnable three-channel codec that disentangles shared information from task-specific details across multiple vision tasks. We characterize the limits of this approach through the notion of lossy common information, and propose an optimization objective that balances inherent tradeoffs in learning such representations. Through comparisons of three codec architectures on two-task scenarios spanning six vision benchmarks, we demonstrate that our approach substantially reduces redundancy and consistently outperforms independent coding. These results highlight the practical value of revisiting Gray-Wyner theory in modern machine learning contexts, bridging classic information theory with task-driven representation learning.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种受Gray-Wyner信息论启发的可学习三通道编解码器，用于在多视觉任务中分离共享信息与任务特定信息，显著减少冗余并提升性能。
AI.motivation: 许多计算机视觉任务存在大量重叠信息，但传统编解码器忽略这一点，导致表示冗余低效。
AI.method: 基于Gray-Wyner网络思想，构建可学习的三通道编解码器，分离共享与任务特有信息；引入损失下公共信息概念，并设计权衡该分离过程的优化目标。
AI.result: 在六个视觉基准上的双任务场景中，相比独立编码，所提方法显著降低冗余并持续取得更优性能。
AI.conclusion: Gray-Wyner理论在现代机器学习中仍具实用价值，能有效桥接经典信息论与面向任务的表征学习。

title: Semantic Content Determines Algorithmic Performance
summary: Counting should not depend on what is being counted; more generally, any algorithm's behavior should be invariant to the semantic content of its arguments. We introduce WhatCounts to test this property in isolation. Unlike prior work that conflates semantic sensitivity with reasoning complexity or prompt variation, WhatCounts is atomic: count items in an unambiguous, delimited list with no duplicates, distractors, or reasoning steps for different semantic types. Frontier LLMs show over 40% accuracy variation depending solely on what is being counted - cities versus chemicals, names versus symbols. Controlled ablations rule out confounds. The gap is semantic, and it shifts unpredictably with small amounts of unrelated fine-tuning. LLMs do not implement algorithms; they approximate them, and the approximation is argument-dependent. As we show with an agentic example, this has implications beyond counting: any LLM function may carry hidden dependencies on the meaning of its inputs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出WhatCounts方法，用于测试大语言模型（LLM）在计数任务中是否具有语义无关性；实验发现前沿LLM在不同语义类型（如城市、化学物质）上准确率差异超40%，表明其并非真正执行算法，而是输入依赖的近似，该问题可能泛化至所有LLM功能。
AI.motivation: 验证LLM是否真正实现与语义无关的算法行为（如计数），而非受输入内容影响的近似行为。
AI.method: 设计WhatCounts基准：在无歧义、无干扰、无推理步骤的原子计数任务中，系统性替换被计数项的语义类型（如城市名、化学式、符号等），控制其他变量不变。
AI.result: 前沿LLM在不同语义类型上计数准确率差异超40%；该差异无法由提示变化、复杂度或训练数据偏差解释，且对微调高度敏感；语义依赖性真实存在且不稳定。
AI.conclusion: LLM不执行严格意义上的算法，而是语义依赖的输入近似；这一缺陷具有普遍性，可能影响所有以语义为输入的功能，对可靠性与可预测性构成根本挑战。

title: Ostrakon-VL: Towards Domain-Expert MLLM for Food-Service and Retail Stores
summary: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) have recently achieved substantial progress in general-purpose perception and reasoning. Nevertheless, their deployment in Food-Service and Retail Stores (FSRS) scenarios encounters two major obstacles: (i) real-world FSRS data, collected from heterogeneous acquisition devices, are highly noisy and lack auditable, closed-loop data curation, which impedes the construction of high-quality, controllable, and reproducible training corpora; and (ii) existing evaluation protocols do not offer a unified, fine-grained and standardized benchmark spanning single-image, multi-image, and video inputs, making it challenging to objectively gauge model robustness. To address these challenges, we first develop Ostrakon-VL, an FSRS-oriented MLLM based on Qwen3-VL-8B. Second, we introduce ShopBench, the first public benchmark for FSRS. Third, we propose QUAD (Quality-aware Unbiased Automated Data-curation), a multi-stage multimodal instruction data curation pipeline. Leveraging a multi-stage training strategy, Ostrakon-VL achieves an average score of 60.1 on ShopBench, establishing a new state of the art among open-source MLLMs with comparable parameter scales and diverse architectures. Notably, it surpasses the substantially larger Qwen3-VL-235B-A22B (59.4) by +0.7, and exceeds the same-scale Qwen3-VL-8B (55.3) by +4.8, demonstrating significantly improved parameter efficiency. These results indicate that Ostrakon-VL delivers more robust and reliable FSRS-centric perception and decision-making capabilities. To facilitate reproducible research, we will publicly release Ostrakon-VL and the ShopBench benchmark.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了面向食品服务和零售商店（FSRS）场景的多模态大语言模型Ostrakon-VL、首个FSRS专用基准ShopBench，以及质量感知的无偏自动化数据整理方法QUAD，显著提升了模型在真实噪声数据下的鲁棒性与参数效率。
AI.motivation: FSRS场景中存在真实数据噪声高、缺乏可审计闭环数据整理，以及缺乏统一细粒度多模态评估基准两大挑战。
AI.method: 提出Ostrakon-VL模型（基于Qwen3-VL-8B）、ShopBench基准（覆盖单图/多图/视频输入）和QUAD多阶段多模态指令数据整理流程，并采用多阶段训练策略。
AI.result: Ostrakon-VL在ShopBench上达60.1平均分，超越更大规模的Qwen3-VL-235B-A22B（59.4）和同规模Qwen3-VL-8B（55.3），验证了其参数效率与鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: Ostrakon-VL显著增强了FSRS场景下感知与决策的可靠性；模型与ShopBench将开源以支持可复现研究。

title: Breaking the Overscaling Curse: Thinking Parallelism Before Parallel Thinking
summary: Parallel thinking enhances LLM reasoning by multi-path sampling and aggregation. In system-level evaluations, a global parallelism level N is allocated to all samples, typically set large to maximize overall dataset accuracy. However, due to sample heterogeneity, some samples can achieve comparable performance with a smaller N'< N, causing budget redundancy. This incompatibility between system-level efficacy and sample-level efficiency constitutes the overscaling curse. In this paper, we formalize and quantify the overscaling curse, showing its universality and severity in practice, and analyze its trigger mechanism. We then propose a lightweight method, T2, to break the overscaling curse, which utilizes latent representations to estimate the optimal parallelism level for each sample before decoding. Experiments show that T2 significantly reduces cost while maintaining comparable performance, enabling more efficient parallel thinking.

AI.tldr: 本文提出T2方法，通过利用潜在表示在解码前估计每个样本的最优并行度，以解决大语言模型中因样本异质性导致的‘过度扩展诅咒’问题，从而在保持性能的同时显著降低成本。
AI.motivation: 由于样本异质性，固定全局高并行度（N）会导致部分样本资源浪费（即‘过度扩展诅咒’），影响推理效率。
AI.method: 提出轻量级方法T2，利用隐层表征预估每个样本所需的最优并行度N'，实现动态、样本级的并行度分配。
AI.result: 实验表明，T2在维持相近性能的同时显著降低计算成本，提升并行推理效率。
AI.conclusion: ‘过度扩展诅咒’普遍存在且严重；T2为高效、自适应的并行推理提供了可行路径。

title: Dynamic Framework for Collaborative Learning: Leveraging Advanced LLM with Adaptive Feedback Mechanisms
summary: This paper presents a framework for integrating LLM into collaborative learning platforms to enhance student engagement, critical thinking, and inclusivity. The framework employs advanced LLMs as dynamic moderators to facilitate real-time discussions and adapt to learners' evolving needs, ensuring diverse and inclusive educational experiences. Key innovations include robust feedback mechanisms that refine AI moderation, promote reflective learning, and balance participation among users. The system's modular architecture featuring ReactJS for the frontend, Flask for backend operations, and efficient question retrieval supports personalized and engaging interactions through dynamic adjustments to prompts and discussion flows. Testing demonstrates that the framework significantly improves student collaboration, fosters deeper comprehension, and scales effectively across various subjects and user groups. By addressing limitations in static moderation and personalization in existing systems, this work establishes a strong foundation for next-generation AI-driven educational tools, advancing equitable and impactful learning outcomes.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种将大语言模型（LLM）集成到协作学习平台的框架，通过LLM作为动态主持人提升学生参与度、批判性思维与包容性，并采用模块化架构（ReactJS前端、Flask后端）实现个性化互动与可扩展性。
AI.motivation: 解决现有教育平台中静态主持和个性化不足的问题，提升协作学习中的参与度、批判性思维与教育包容性。
AI.method: 构建基于LLM的动态主持人框架，结合ReactJS前端、Flask后端与高效问题检索模块；引入鲁棒反馈机制优化AI主持、促进反思性学习并平衡用户参与。
AI.result: 实验证明该框架显著提升学生协作效果、加深理解程度，并在多学科及不同用户群体中具有良好可扩展性。
AI.conclusion: 该工作为下一代AI驱动教育工具奠定坚实基础，推动公平且有影响力的学习成果发展。

title: SWE-Spot: Building Small Repo-Experts with Repository-Centric Learning
summary: The deployment of coding agents in privacy-sensitive and resource-constrained environments drives the demand for capable open-weight Small Language Models (SLMs). However, they suffer from a fundamental capability gap: unlike frontier large models, they lack the inference-time strong generalization to work with complicated, unfamiliar codebases. We identify that the prevailing Task-Centric Learning (TCL) paradigm, which scales exposure across disparate repositories, fails to address this limitation. In response, we propose Repository-Centric Learning (RCL), a paradigm shift that prioritizes vertical repository depth over horizontal task breadth, suggesting SLMs must internalize the "physics" of a target software environment through parametric knowledge acquisition, rather than attempting to recover it via costly inference-time search. Following this new paradigm, we design a four-unit Repository-Centric Experience, transforming static codebases into interactive learning signals, to train SWE-Spot-4B, a family of highly compact models built as repo-specialized experts that breaks established scaling trends, outperforming open-weight models up to larger (e.g., CWM by Meta, Qwen3-Coder-30B) and surpassing/matching efficiency-focused commercial models (e.g., GPT-4.1-mini, GPT-5-nano) across multiple SWE tasks. Further analysis reveals that RCL yields higher training sample efficiency and lower inference costs, emphasizing that for building efficient intelligence, repository mastery is a distinct and necessary dimension that complements general coding capability.

AI.tldr: 本文提出Repository-Centric Learning（RCL）新范式，通过深度学习单个代码仓库的内在结构（“physics”），训练出轻量级但高度专业化的代码模型SWE-Spot-4B，在多项软件工程任务上超越更大尺寸开源模型及部分商用小模型。
AI.motivation: 现有小语言模型（SLMs）在隐私敏感和资源受限场景中部署需求迫切，但其推理时泛化能力弱，难以应对陌生复杂代码库；传统任务中心学习（TCL）范式无法弥补该能力缺口。
AI.method: 提出以代码仓库为中心的学习（RCL）范式，强调对单个仓库的纵向深度理解而非跨任务广度覆盖；设计四单元‘Repository-Centric Experience’，将静态代码库转化为交互式学习信号；据此训练SWE-Spot-4B系列小型专家模型。
AI.result: SWE-Spot-4B在多个SWE任务上优于更大开源模型（如CWM、Qwen3-Coder-30B）及效率导向商用模型（如GPT-4.1-mini、GPT-5-nano）；同时具备更高训练样本效率与更低推理开销。
AI.conclusion: 仓库级掌握是构建高效智能不可或缺的新维度，应与通用编码能力互补；RCL范式为小模型在真实软件环境中的实用化提供了新路径。

title: BEAP-Agent: Backtrackable Execution and Adaptive Planning for GUI Agents
summary: GUI agents are designed to automate repetitive tasks and enhance productivity. However, existing GUI agents struggle to recover once they follow an incorrect exploration path, often leading to task failure. In this work, we model GUI task execution as a DFS process and propose BEAP-Agent, a DFS-based framework that supports long-range, multi-level state backtracking with dynamic task tracking and updating. The framework consists of three collaborative components: Planner, Executor, and Tracker. Together, they enable effective task exploration and execution. BEAP-Agent fills the gap in systematic backtracking mechanisms for GUI agents, offering a systematic solution for long-horizon task exploration. We conducted a systematic evaluation on the OSWorld benchmark, where BEAP-Agent achieved an accuracy of 28.2%, validating the effectiveness of the proposed method.

AI.tldr: 本文提出BEAP-Agent，一种基于深度优先搜索（DFS）的GUI智能体框架，通过支持长距离、多层级状态回溯及动态任务追踪，显著提升GUI任务执行的鲁棒性与成功率。
AI.motivation: 现有GUI智能体在探索路径出错后难以恢复，导致任务失败，缺乏系统性的回溯机制。
AI.method: 将GUI任务执行建模为DFS过程，设计包含Planner、Executor和Tracker三个协同组件的BEAP-Agent框架，支持动态任务跟踪与多级状态回溯。
AI.result: 在OSWorld基准上达到28.2%的任务准确率，验证了方法的有效性。
AI.conclusion: BEAP-Agent填补了GUI智能体系统化回溯机制的空白，为长周期GUI任务探索提供了新范式。

title: SONIC-O1: A Real-World Benchmark for Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models on Audio-Video Understanding
summary: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) are a major focus of recent AI research. However, most prior work focuses on static image understanding, while their ability to process sequential audio-video data remains underexplored. This gap highlights the need for a high-quality benchmark to systematically evaluate MLLM performance in a real-world setting. We introduce SONIC-O1, a comprehensive, fully human-verified benchmark spanning 13 real-world conversational domains with 4,958 annotations and demographic metadata. SONIC-O1 evaluates MLLMs on key tasks, including open-ended summarization, multiple-choice question (MCQ) answering, and temporal localization with supporting rationales (reasoning). Experiments on closed- and open-source models reveal limitations. While the performance gap in MCQ accuracy between two model families is relatively small, we observe a substantial 22.6% performance difference in temporal localization between the best performing closed-source and open-source models. Performance further degrades across demographic groups, indicating persistent disparities in model behavior. Overall, SONIC-O1 provides an open evaluation suite for temporally grounded and socially robust multimodal understanding. We release SONIC-O1 for reproducibility and research: Project page: https://vectorinstitute.github.io/sonic-o1/ Dataset: https://huggingface.co/datasets/vector-institute/sonic-o1 Github: https://github.com/vectorinstitute/sonic-o1 Leaderboard: https://huggingface.co/spaces/vector-institute/sonic-o1-leaderboard

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了SONIC-O1，一个面向真实世界对话场景、涵盖13个领域、含4958条人工标注的高质量音视频多模态大模型评测基准，重点评估开放摘要、多选问答和时序定位等任务，并揭示了现有模型在时序理解与社会鲁棒性上的显著差距。
AI.motivation: 现有MLLM研究主要集中于静态图像理解，而对动态音视频序列的理解能力缺乏系统评估，亟需一个高质量、真实场景驱动、具备社会意识的评测基准。
AI.method: 构建了完全由人工验证的SONIC-O1基准，覆盖13个真实对话领域，包含4958条带人口统计元数据的标注样本；设计三类核心任务：开放摘要、多选问答（MCQ）和带推理依据的时序定位；在闭源与开源MLLM上开展系统评测。
AI.result: 实验发现：两类模型在MCQ任务上性能差距较小，但在时序定位任务上存在高达22.6%的显著差异；且所有模型在不同人口统计子群中表现持续下降，暴露出社会鲁棒性不足。
AI.conclusion: SONIC-O1填补了音视频时序多模态理解评测的空白，提供了首个兼顾时间接地性与社会鲁棒性的开放评测套件，推动MLLM向更可靠、公平的现实应用发展。

title: Beyond Forgetting: Machine Unlearning Elicits Controllable Side Behaviors and Capabilities
summary: We consider representation misdirection (RM), a class of LLM unlearning methods that achieves forgetting by manipulating the forget-representations, that is, latent representations of forget samples. Despite being important, the roles of target vectors used in RM, however, remain underexplored. Here, we approach and revisit RM through the lens of the linear representation hypothesis. Specifically, if one can somehow identify a one-dimensional representation corresponding to a high-level concept, the linear representation hypothesis enables linear operations on this concept vector within the forget-representation space. Under this view, we hypothesize that, beyond forgetting, machine unlearning elicits controllable side behaviors and stronger side capabilities corresponding to the high-level concept. Our hypothesis is empirically validated across a wide range of tasks, including behavioral control (e.g., controlling unlearned models' truth, sentiment, and refusal) and capability enhancement (e.g., improving unlearned models' in-context learning capability). Our findings reveal that this fairly attractive phenomenon could be either a hidden risk if misused or a mechanism that can be harnessed for developing models that require stronger capabilities and controllable behaviors.

AI.tldr: 本文提出并研究了表示误导（RM）这一类大语言模型（LLM）遗忘方法，通过操纵遗忘样本的潜在表示（forget-representations）实现遗忘；基于线性表示假设，发现用于RM的目标向量不仅能实现遗忘，还能激发可控的行为调控与能力增强等副作用，并揭示其潜在风险与应用价值。
AI.motivation: 尽管表示误导（RM）是一类重要的LLM遗忘方法，但其中目标向量所起的作用尚未被充分探索。本文旨在从线性表示假设出发，重新审视RM中目标向量的深层作用。
AI.method: 基于线性表示假设，将高阶概念建模为一维表示向量，并在forget-representation空间中进行线性操作；通过实证分析验证RM在行为控制（如真实性、情感、拒绝倾向）和能力增强（如上下文学习能力）方面的副作用。
AI.result: 发现RM不仅实现遗忘，还一致引发可控的侧向行为与更强的高阶能力；该现象在多种任务上被广泛验证。
AI.conclusion: RM中的目标向量具有双重效应：既带来潜在滥用风险，也提供了一种可利用机制，用于构建具备更强能力和可控行为的新一代模型。

title: FBS: Modeling Native Parallel Reading inside a Transformer
summary: Large language models (LLMs) excel across many tasks, yet inference is still dominated by strictly token-by-token autoregression. Existing acceleration methods largely patch this pipeline and miss core human-reading ingredients: content-adaptive foresight, chunk-structure-aware compute allocation, and train--test consistency for preview/skimming. We propose the \textbf{Fovea-Block-Skip Transformer} (FBS), which injects a causal, trainable loop into Transformers via Parafovea-Attention Window (PAW), Chunk-Head (CH), and Skip-Gate (SG). Across diverse benchmarks, FBS improves the quality-efficiency trade-off without increasing parameters, and ablations show the three modules are complementary.

AI.tldr: 本文提出Fovea-Block-Skip Transformer（FBS），通过引入Parafovea-Attention Window、Chunk-Head和Skip-Gate三个模块，在不增加参数的前提下提升大语言模型推理的质量与效率权衡。
AI.motivation: 现有大语言模型推理仍依赖严格的逐token自回归，缺乏人类阅读中的内容自适应前瞻、块结构感知计算分配以及预览/略读的训推一致性。
AI.method: 提出FBS架构，包含因果可训练循环机制，具体由Parafovea-Attention Window（PAW）、Chunk-Head（CH）和Skip-Gate（SG）三个模块组成。
AI.result: 在多个基准测试中，FBS显著改善质量-效率权衡；消融实验表明三个模块互补且有效。
AI.conclusion: FBS为大语言模型推理提供了更符合人类阅读机制的高效新范式，无需额外参数即可实现性能提升。

title: Hebbian Learning with Global Direction
summary: Backpropagation algorithm has driven the remarkable success of deep neural networks, but its lack of biological plausibility and high computational costs have motivated the ongoing search for alternative training methods. Hebbian learning has attracted considerable interest as a biologically plausible alternative to backpropagation. Nevertheless, its exclusive reliance on local information, without consideration of global task objectives, fundamentally limits its scalability. Inspired by the biological synergy between neuromodulators and local plasticity, we introduce a novel model-agnostic Global-guided Hebbian Learning (GHL) framework, which seamlessly integrates local and global information to scale up across diverse networks and tasks. In specific, the local component employs Oja's rule with competitive learning to ensure stable and effective local updates. Meanwhile, the global component introduces a sign-based signal that guides the direction of local Hebbian plasticity updates. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our method consistently outperforms existing Hebbian approaches. Notably, on large-scale network and complex datasets like ImageNet, our framework achieves the competitive results and significantly narrows the gap with standard backpropagation.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种模型无关的全局引导赫布学习（GHL）框架，通过结合局部赫布学习与全局任务导向信号，在保持生物可解释性的同时提升性能，尤其在大规模网络和复杂数据集（如ImageNet）上显著缩小与反向传播的差距。
AI.motivation: 反向传播虽成功但缺乏生物可解释性且计算开销大；传统赫布学习仅依赖局部信息，难以兼顾全局任务目标，限制其可扩展性。
AI.method: 提出Global-guided Hebbian Learning（GHL）框架：局部部分采用Oja规则加竞争学习以保证稳定性；全局部分引入基于符号的引导信号，调控局部赫布可塑性方向。
AI.result: 在多种网络和任务上持续优于现有赫布学习方法；在ImageNet等大规模复杂任务上达到与标准反向传播具有竞争力的性能，显著缩小性能差距。
AI.conclusion: GHL成功融合局部可塑性与全局任务指导，是一种兼具生物合理性、可扩展性和高性能的新型训练范式，为替代反向传播提供了有力候选方案。

title: Visual-Guided Key-Token Regularization for Multimodal Large Language Model Unlearning
summary: Unlearning in Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) prevents the model from revealing private information when queried about target images. Existing MLLM unlearning methods largely adopt approaches developed for LLMs. They treat all answer tokens uniformly, disregarding their varying importance in the unlearning process. Moreover, these methods focus exclusively on the language modality, disregarding visual cues that indicate key tokens in answers. In this paper, after formulating the problem of unlearning in multimodal question answering for MLLMs, we propose Visual-Guided Key-Token Regularization (ViKeR). We leverage irrelevant visual inputs to predict ideal post-unlearning token-level distributions and use these distributions to regularize the unlearning process, thereby prioritizing key tokens. Further, we define key tokens in unlearning via information entropy and discuss ViKeR's effectiveness through token-level gradient reweighting, which amplifies updates on key tokens. Experiments on MLLMU and CLEAR benchmarks demonstrate that our method effectively performs unlearning while mitigating forgetting and maintaining response coherence.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种面向多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）的视觉引导关键词正则化方法（ViKeR），通过利用无关视觉输入预测目标词级分布，结合信息熵定义关键token，并通过梯度重加权增强关键token更新，从而在图像级遗忘任务中实现高效、低遗忘、高连贯性的未学习效果。
AI.motivation: 现有MLLM遗忘方法直接套用LLM方法，忽视了多模态特性：未区分答案中各token的重要性，且仅关注语言模态而忽略视觉线索对关键token的指示作用。
AI.method: 提出Visual-Guided Key-Token Regularization (ViKeR)：1）形式化MLLM多模态问答中的遗忘问题；2）利用无关视觉输入预测理想遗忘后token分布并用于正则化；3）基于信息熵定义关键token；4）通过token级梯度重加权放大关键token的参数更新。
AI.result: 在MLLMU和CLEAR基准上验证，ViKeR在有效遗忘目标图像的同时，显著缓解了知识遗忘（forgetting）并保持了回答的语义连贯性。
AI.conclusion: 视觉线索可有效指导MLLM中关键答案token的识别与正则化，ViKeR通过多模态协同建模提升了遗忘的精准性与模型整体稳定性。

title: NEMO: Execution-Aware Optimization Modeling via Autonomous Coding Agents
summary:
In this paper, we present NEMO, a system that translates Natural-language descriptions of decision problems into formal Executable Mathematical Optimization implementations, operating collaboratively with users or autonomously. Existing approaches typically rely on specialized large language models (LLMs) or bespoke, task-specific agents. Such methods are often brittle, complex and frequently generating syntactically invalid or non-executable code.
  NEMO instead centers on remote interaction with autonomous coding agents (ACAs), treated as a first-class abstraction analogous to API-based interaction with LLMs. This design enables the construction of higher-level systems around ACAs that structure, consolidate, and iteratively refine task specifications. Because ACAs execute within sandboxed environments, code produced by NEMO is executable by construction, allowing automated validation and repair.
  Building on this, we introduce novel coordination patterns with and across ACAs, including asymmetric validation loops between independently generated optimizer and simulator implementations (serving as a high-level validation mechanism), external memory for experience reuse, and robustness enhancements via minimum Bayes risk (MBR) decoding and self-consistency. We evaluate NEMO on nine established optimization benchmarks. As depicted in Figure 1, it achieves state-of-the-art performance on the majority of tasks, with substantial margins on several datasets, demonstrating the power of execution-aware agentic architectures for automated optimization modeling.

AI.tldr: NEMO 是一个将自然语言描述的决策问题自动转化为可执行数学优化实现的系统，通过与自主编码代理（ACAs）远程协作，确保生成代码的正确性和可执行性，并在多个基准上达到领先性能。
AI.motivation: 现有方法依赖专用大语言模型或定制化代理，常导致生成代码语法错误或不可执行，缺乏鲁棒性和可验证性。
AI.method: 提出以自主编码代理（ACAs）为核心的设计，引入异步验证循环、外部记忆复用、最小贝叶斯风险解码和自一致性等新型协调机制，并在沙箱环境中执行与验证代码。
AI.result: 在九个标准优化基准上评估，NEMO 在大多数任务中达到当前最优性能，多个数据集上显著领先。
AI.conclusion: 执行感知的智能体架构能有效提升自动化优化建模的准确性、鲁棒性与实用性。

title: TeachBench: A Syllabus-Grounded Framework for Evaluating Teaching Ability in Large Language Models
summary: Large language models (LLMs) show promise as teaching assistants, yet their teaching capability remains insufficiently evaluated. Existing benchmarks mainly focus on problem-solving or problem-level guidance, leaving knowledge-centered teaching underexplored. We propose a syllabus-grounded evaluation framework that measures LLM teaching capability via student performance improvement after multi-turn instruction. By restricting teacher agents to structured knowledge points and example problems, the framework avoids information leakage and enables reuse of existing benchmarks. We instantiate the framework on Gaokao data across multiple subjects. Experiments reveal substantial variation in teaching effectiveness across models and domains: some models perform well in mathematics, while teaching remains challenging in physics and chemistry. We also find that incorporating example problems does not necessarily improve teaching, as models often shift toward example-specific error correction. Overall, our results highlight teaching ability as a distinct and measurable dimension of LLM behavior.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于教学大纲的评估框架，用于衡量大语言模型（LLMs）作为教学助手的教学能力，通过学生在多轮教学后的表现提升来评估，并在高考数据上进行了实验验证。
AI.motivation: 现有基准主要关注问题解决或问题级指导，缺乏对知识中心型教学能力的评估，因此需要一种更全面、结构化的教学能力评测方法。
AI.method: 构建了一个以教学大纲为依据的评估框架，限制教师模型仅使用结构化知识点和例题进行多轮教学，并以学生表现提升作为核心指标；在高考（Gaokao）多学科数据上实例化该框架。
AI.result: 实验显示不同模型及学科间教学效果差异显著（如数学表现较好，物理与化学较弱）；引入例题未必提升教学效果，模型易陷入针对例题的纠错而非通用知识传授。
AI.conclusion: 教学能力是大语言模型行为中一个独立且可量化的维度，需专门设计评估框架加以衡量。

title: From Meta-Thought to Execution: Cognitively Aligned Post-Training for Generalizable and Reliable LLM Reasoning
summary: Current LLM post-training methods optimize complete reasoning trajectories through Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) followed by outcome-based Reinforcement Learning (RL). While effective, a closer examination reveals a fundamental gap: this approach does not align with how humans actually solve problems. Human cognition naturally decomposes problem-solving into two distinct stages: first acquiring abstract strategies (i.e., meta-knowledge) that generalize across problems, then adapting them to specific instances. In contrast, by treating complete trajectories as basic units, current methods are inherently problem-centric, entangling abstract strategies with problem-specific execution. To address this misalignment, we propose a cognitively-inspired framework that explicitly mirrors the two-stage human cognitive process. Specifically, Chain-of-Meta-Thought (CoMT) focuses supervised learning on abstract reasoning patterns without specific executions, enabling acquisition of generalizable strategies. Confidence-Calibrated Reinforcement Learning (CCRL) then optimizes task adaptation via confidence-aware rewards on intermediate steps, preventing overconfident errors from cascading and improving execution reliability. Experiments across four models and eight benchmarks show 2.19\% and 4.63\% improvements in-distribution and out-of-distribution respectively over standard methods, while reducing training time by 65-70% and token consumption by 50%, demonstrating that aligning post-training with human cognitive principles yields not only superior generalization but also enhanced training efficiency.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种认知启发的LLM后训练框架CoMT+CCRL，将人类解题的两阶段（抽象策略学习+具体任务适配）融入模型训练，在提升泛化能力的同时显著降低训练开销。
AI.motivation: 现有LLM后训练方法（SFT+RL）以完整推理轨迹为单位进行优化，与人类先学抽象策略、再适配具体问题的认知过程不一致，导致策略与执行耦合、泛化性差、效率低。
AI.method: 提出两阶段框架：1）Chain-of-Meta-Thought（CoMT），通过监督学习抽象推理模式（剥离具体执行），获取可迁移的元知识；2）Confidence-Calibrated RL（CCRL），在中间步骤引入置信度感知奖励，抑制错误累积，提升执行可靠性。
AI.result: 在4个模型、8个基准上，相比标准方法，ID和OOD性能分别提升2.19%和4.63%，训练时间减少65–70%，token消耗降低50%。
